moves.4... b6 5. Nf3: I bring up my knight in case my opponent unleashes his bishop.
moves.5... h6 6. Nc3 Nb4: He eyes up my c-pawn, and even my queen...
moves.8... c4: ...my bishop is attacked by the pawn...
moves.10... Qc7 11. Qd2: Now I decide I need to cover the square from a queen attack...
moves.12... Qxc3+ 13. bxc3: ...and we exchange queens. I didn't know what I was doing then, as I have distorted my pawn structure.
moves.17. Rfe1: ...but manage to pin the knight down to its file...
moves.17... d5: ...but I can no longer use the rook to remove the knight...
moves.18. Nd2: ...so instead, I bring one of mine to attack it, to ensure no net loss...
moves.18... f5: ...but another pawn comes to protect the previous one.
moves.20. Nf4: ...and my remaining one has to move out of the way.
moves.20... Bc4 21. Ne6: I eye up the rook in the far left-hand corner...
moves.21... Kd7: ...but my opponent is wise to this...
moves.23. Bd4: I decide my pawn needs cover...
moves.23... Rf7: ...and my opponent decides likewise for his pawn.
moves.24. Reb1: I move this rook to keep its twin's pawn covered.
moves.24... Ba6: He covers the b7 square in case I decide to check...
moves.25... Bc4: ...and he moves his bishop to cover...
moves.26. Bd4: ...so I open up the b-file again.
moves.26... g6: This time he moves his g-pawn forwards...
moves.27. Rb7+: ...allowing me to check and therefore expose a rook...
moves.29. f3: I attack his pawn furthest forward...
moves.30. a3: ...so I push my far left-hand pawn up one, so the bishop can't attack it...
moves.31. fxe4: ...and finally I remove the pawn on my fourth rank...
moves.33. Rxe4: ...but I create some space by removing his pawn on e4...
moves.34. Be5 Bd5 35. Rxa4: I remove the one on my far left, creating more space...
moves.36. Kf1: ...and I move here to avoid being trapped.
moves.36... Ra2 37. Ra7+ Ke6 38. Bd4 Rxh2: Now both our left-hand sides are open...
moves.40... Ke7 41. Rxg6: ...to create more space on my right.
moves.44. Rg1: ...so I block for a possible swap...
moves.44... Bc4+: ...but he attacks me from another side...
moves.45. Kf2: ...so I stay close to my rook, although the bishop has it covered.
moves.45... Rh2+ 46. Rg2: I again go for the blocking move...
moves.47. Rg7+: ...so I attack his king once more...
moves.52... Rh4 53. Rg3: ...but keep it marshalled here. Putting mine on g3 made sure it couldn't escape and wreak havoc.
moves.57... Rh1 58. Rg1: ...and replicate this position for a third time. Keeping the rook under control ensured that it couldn't get too far.
